name: Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning
mission: The sole purpose of our existence is to educate people about moral, ethical, and human values as taught in Islam. We aim to separate history and culture from religion and teach it in its purest form as a field of study rather than as a creed. Our teaching method uses common sense, argument, and logic, and we highly value critical thinking over the blind following.
theoryOfChange: By teaching Islam as a field of study based on reason and the Quran/Sunnah (Tazkiyah al-Nafs), the organization aims to purify individual and collective human life from defilements and cultural accretions.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 and focuses on capacity building.
Total revenue was $816,038 with a program expense ratio of 75.2% and programs including AskGhamidi and translations.
The charity provides multiple donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity demonstrates solid financial health and efficiency with a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100, though its overall impact score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing impact measurement frameworks to better quantify the long-term outcomes of educational programs.
Increasing transparency regarding specific beneficiary reach across its various digital platforms.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 25/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors seeking intellectual and educational reform within a global context [1]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill religious obligations through its various educational and translation initiatives [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization shows moderate impact with a score of 34/50, primarily functioning through capacity building and educational dissemination [1]. It maintains a healthy financial profile with total revenue of $816,038 and a program expense ratio of 75.2%, ensuring that the majority of funds support its core mission [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: AL-Mawrid United States Inc promotes a rational and objective approach to Islamic education through scholarly research and global outreach.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 75.2%, indicating a strong commitment to direct mission-related activities.
Excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1.
Strong liquidity position with 10.9 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in the United States, AL-Mawrid focuses on teaching people how to explore and practice Islam through reason and rationality [3]. The organization operates key programs including the AskGhamidi platform, educational courses, and extensive translation services to make scholarly work accessible worldwide [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity demonstrates solid financial health and efficiency with a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100, though its overall impact score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and an <cite id="[1]">overall score of 84.5/100</cite> from Charity Navigator, despite meeting <cite id="[1]">0 of 20 BBB standards</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could expand its board size beyond 3 members and work toward meeting BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards.

impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from tracking cost-per-beneficiary across individual programs and commissioning independent evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates the organization tracks basic outcome metrics and has a verified theory of change, but lacks rigorous third-party RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Provides research and educational environments where Islamic religious thought can evolve and be taught rationally.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact in educational capacity building.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has stable operations but stagnant revenue growth, indicating room to absorb funds for expansion.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="[3]">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>, demonstrating a strong commitment to directing funds toward its educational mission.
AL-Mawrid is highly efficient in its development efforts, <cite id="[3]">spending $0.11 to raise every $1</cite>.
The charity maintains a strong liquidity position with <cite id="[1]">10.9 months of working capital</cite> available for operations.

strengths_deep_dive: AL-Mawrid United States Inc demonstrates robust financial health and operational efficiency. With <cite id="[3]">$816,038 in annual revenue</cite>, the organization efficiently channels resources to its core mission, evidenced by its <cite id="[3]">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are highly optimized, <cite id="[3]">spending $0.11 to raise every $1</cite>. The organization's commitment to transparency is highlighted by its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and an <cite id="[1]">overall score of 84.5/100</cite> from Charity Navigator.
rich_narrative.summary: AL-Mawrid United States Inc is an educational organization <cite id="[4]">founded in 2014</cite> that promotes a rational and objective approach to Islamic education through scholarly research and global outreach. The organization operates key programs including educational classes, Sunday school, discussion groups, and scholar appointments. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="[3]">$816,038 in annual revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. AL-Mawrid demonstrates strong financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="[3]">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite> and <cite id="[3]">spending $0.11 to raise every $1</cite>. The charity holds an <cite id="[1]">overall score of 84.5/100</cite> from Charity Navigator and is verified as <cite id="[2]">zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically accepting funds for the fisabilillah category. The organization holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, reflecting its commitment to sharing outcome metrics and organizational data.
